definitions.definition: Ground ploughed and harrowed but left unseeded for one year.
Uncultivated land.
The ploughing or tilling of land, without sowing it for a season.
(of agricultural land) Ploughed but left unseeded for more than one planting season.
(of agricultural land) Left unworked and uncropped for some amount of time.
Inactive; undeveloped.
definitions.example: a fallow period in one's career

definitions.definition: To make land fallow for agricultural purposes.
(color) Of a pale red or yellow, light brown; dun.
definitions.example: a fallow deer or greyhound

definitions.definition: A cutting tool similar to scissors, but often larger.
The act of shearing, or something removed by shearing.
Forces that push in opposite directions.
A transformation that displaces every point in a direction parallel to some given line by a distance proportional to the point’s distance from the line.
The response of a rock to deformation usually by compressive stress, resulting in particular textures.
To cut, originally with a sword or other bladed weapon, now usually with shears, or as if using shears.
To remove the fleece from a sheep etc by clipping.
To deform because of forces pushing in opposite directions.
To transform by displacing every point in a direction parallel to some given line by a distance proportional to the point’s distance from the line.
To make a vertical cut in the coal.
To reap, as grain.
To deprive of property; to fleece.
The symbol *.
Something in the shape of or resembling the asterisk symbol.
A blemish in an otherwise outstanding achievement.
definitions.example: They came into the tournament highly ranked, but with a little bit of an asterisk as their last two wins had been unconvincing.

definitions.definition: To mark or replace with an asterisk symbol (*); star.
(of a disease or symptom) That occurs at the same time as another.
The act of cleaving or the state of being cleft.
The hollow or separation between a woman's breasts, especially as revealed by a low neckline.
(by extension) Any similar separation between two body parts, such as the buttocks or toes.
The repeated division of a cell into daughter cells after mitosis.
The splitting of a large molecule into smaller ones.
The tendency of a crystal to split along specific planes.
The division of voters into voting blocs.
A lightweight shirt without buttons, usually with short sleeves and no collar. Often made of cotton and frequently bears a picture or slogan.
definitions.example: Many bands make more money from T-shirt sales than from sale of tickets.

definitions.definition: An undershirt.
The act of enfranchising
A release from slavery
The investiture with any of several municipal privileges
Conversion of a copyhold estate into a freehold
definitions.example: enfranchisement of copyhold

definitions.definition: (of food) Having a thick, semi-solid consistency; glutinous; heavy on the stomach.
Dull, old-fashioned.
definitions.example: I gave up trying to get that stodgy club to try anything new.

definitions.definition: Badly put together.
A unit of a poem, written or printed as a paragraph; equivalent to a verse.
An apartment or division in a building.
An XML element which acts as basic unit of meaning in XMPP.
A segment; a portion of a broadcast devoted to a particular topic.
A period; an interval into which a sporting event is divided.
A person who navigates, especially an officer with that responsibility on a ship or an aircrew member with that responsibility on an aircraft.
A sea explorer.
A device that navigates an aircraft, automobile or missile.
A user interface that allows navigating through a structure of any kind.
A labourer on an engineering project such as a canal; a navvy.
A heavy fabric, usually made of cotton, with vertical ribs.
Cheap and poor-quality whiskey.

A pattern on snow resulting from the use of a snow groomer to pack snow and improve skiing, snowboarding and snowmobile trail conditions. Corduroy is widely regarded as a good surface on which to ski or ride.
To make (a road) by laying down split logs or tree-trunks over a marsh, swamp etc.
Traffic control by a police officer stationed at an intersection.
A tricycle.
A three-wheeled motorbike.
A kind of railroad maintenance vehicle: a speeder or jigger.
To tricycle; to travel by tricycle.
A triceratops.
An instance of hijacking; the illegal seizure of a vehicle; a hijacking.
An instance of a seizure and redirection of a process.
An amendment which deletes the contents of a bill and inserts entirely new provisions.
Preflop, the position two before the dealer.
To forcibly stop and seize control of some vehicle in order to rob it or to reach a destination (especially an airplane, truck or a boat).
To seize control of some process or resource to achieve a purpose other than its originally intended one.
To seize control of a networked computer by means of infecting it with a worm or other malware, thereby turning it into a zombie.
To change software settings without a user's knowledge so as to force that user to visit a certain web site (to hijack a browser).
To introduce an amendment deleting the contents of a bill and inserting entirely new provisions.
Any process by which plants and other photoautotrophs convert light energy into chemical energy,
(of wind) Blowing in gusts; blustery; tempestuous.
(by extension, metaphoric) Characterized by or occurring in instances of sudden strong expression
(metaphoric) Bombastic, verbose.
With gusto
A short report, especially one released through official channels to be broadcast or publicized.
A short news report.
A short printed publication, especially one produced by an organization.
To announce something by means of such a report or publication.
To convince not to try or do.
definitions.example: Jane dissuaded Martha from committing suicide.

definitions.definition: An order for goods or services placed in advance.
A binary relation that is reflexive and transitive.
definitions.example: The relation of logical implication over sentences is an example of a preorder.

definitions.definition: To order (goods or services) in advance, before they are available.
To sort or arrange beforehand.
(of a traversal of a tree) Such that, recursively, the root is visited before the left and right subtrees.
One who loves, supports, or favours peace.
definitions.example: Mahatma Gandhi was one of the world's most famous pacifists.

definitions.definition: One who prefers to avoid violence.
One who opposes violence and is anti-war.
A player who attempts the challenge of winning a game without attacking any enemy characters.
Of or relating to pacifism.
Treat with a vaccine to produce immunity against a disease.
Methylated spirits mixed with red wine or Condy's crystals.
A baby mouse, especially when used as food for a snake, etc.
A white person.
The Australasian snapper or pink snapper (Chrysophrys auratus).
Pinkish.
The smallest finger or toe of a hand or foot.
Winking
The end or final point of something.
The end point of a transportation system, or the town or city in which it is located.
A boundary or border, or a post or stone marking such a boundary.
Blood that is needed for continued life; blood regarded as the seat of life.
That which is required for continued existence or function.
definitions.example: Gasoline is the lifeblood of the modern city.

definitions.definition: A television program shown after its initial presentation — particularly many weeks after its initial presentation; a repeat.
Another printing run (impression; batch of copies of a given edition) of a book, cartoon, etc.
A political candidate who holds the same political agenda or doctrine as a past or incumbent holder of a given political office.
A second or subsequent run of a program.
definitions.example: Each rerun of the algorithm takes several minutes.

definitions.definition: To run (a previously broadcast television program) again.
To run (a race) again.
To run (a computer program) again.
A sleeveless shirt for women, sometimes provided with detachable sleeves.
Blouse; any shirt for women, particularly the upper part of a two-piece dress or European folk costume.
The upper portion of a women's one-piece dress, equivalent to a shirt.
Underbodice: an undershirt for women, particularly a corset or other undershirt stiffened with whalebone.
The state or condition of being illegitimate
(retail) The part of a department store that sells food.
A commercially-operated collection of rides, games and other entertainment attractions.
An Indian bread with a texture somewhat resembling puff pastry; sometimes stuffed with vegetables etc.
Any radioactive substance.
Exhibiting radioactivity.
Dangerous and disgusting, particularly of people or ideas.
definitions.example: Even sleazy tactics and his radioactive mouth may not be able to contain this debacle.

definitions.definition: To take a joyride.
An instance of somebody taking a joyride.
Danish pastry, light sweet yeast-raised roll usually filled with fruit or cheese.
definitions.example: Get me a coffee and a cheese danish.

definitions.definition: Of a system or protocol, such that it does not keep a persistent state between transactions.
definitions.example: A stateless server treats each request independently.

definitions.definition: Without state or pomp.
Without a state or nationality, not subject to any state.
definitions.example: UN Convention relating to the Status of Stateless Persons

definitions.definition: Neither believing in nor supporting the idea of nations.
Each of the flashing lights on each side of a vehicle which indicate a turn is being made to left or right, or a lane change etc.
A sign or signal indicating that a hindrance or danger is clear.
An act of respraying.
definitions.example: I bought a second-hand car but I don't like the colour, so I'm taking it in for a respray.

definitions.definition: To spray again.
definitions.example: My car's got a big scratch down one side — I'll have to get it resprayed.

definitions.definition: A female leader of a work crew (a female foreperson or female foreman).
A female foreman of a jury.
Not distinguished: not marked by conspicuous qualities.
Not distinguished: not having an air of distinction.

A grating; a grid of wire or a sheet of material with a pattern of holes or slots, usually used to protect something while allowing the passage of air and liquids. Typical uses: to allow air through a fan while preventing fingers or objects from passing; to allow people to talk to somebody, while preventing attack.
On a vehicle, a slotted cover as above, to protect and hide the radiator, while admitting air to cool it.
A cooking device comprising a source of radiative heat and a means of holding food under it; a broiler in US English
A cooking device comprising a source of radiative and convective heat and a means of holding food above it; a barbecue.
definitions.example: I put some peppers and mushrooms on the grill to go with dinner.

definitions.definition: Food (designed to be) cooked on a grill.
definitions.example: a packet of frozen cauliflower cheese grills

definitions.definition: A grillroom; a restaurant serving grilled food.
definitions.example: These coupons will get you a discount at Johnny's Bar and Grill.

definitions.definition: A type of jewelry worn on the front teeth.
(by extension) The front teeth regarded collectively.
To cook (food) on a grill; to barbecue.
definitions.example: Why don't we get together Saturday and grill some burgers?

definitions.definition: To cook food under the element of a stove or only under the top element of an oven – broil, salamander.
To interrogate; to question aggressively or harshly.
definitions.example: The police grilled him about his movements at the time of the crime.

definitions.definition: To feel very hot; to swelter.
To stamp or mark with a grill.
To make angry; provoke; incite.
To terrify; make tremble.
To tremble; shiver.
To snarl; snap.
Harm.
Harsh, rough, severe; cruel.
A situation of serious and immediate danger.
Something that causes, contains, or presents danger.
definitions.example: The perils of the jungle (animals and insects, weather, etc)

definitions.definition: An event which causes a loss, or the risk of a specific such event.
To cause to be in danger; to imperil; to risk.
The state of lacking consciousness, of being unconscious
definitions.example: I was roused from unconsciousness by the alarm clock.

definitions.definition: Ignorance or innocence; the state of being uninformed or unaware
A window sash that is hinged on the side.
A window having such sashes; a casement window.Wp
Occasionally seen as a usage error due to the similarity of the words: A casemate.
Responsible travel to natural areas supporting the fauna, flora, and local economy
definitions.example: Ecotourism serves the environment and improves the well-being of indigenous peoples, too.

definitions.definition: A grandmother.
definitions.example: I'm going to be a granny.

definitions.definition: An elderly woman.
definitions.example: There are too many grannies around here getting in the way.

definitions.definition: (knots) A granny knot.
(farming) An older ewe that may lure a lamb away from its mother.
To be a grandmother.
To act like a stereotypical grandmother; to fuss.
Typically or stereotypically old-fashioned, especially in clothing and accessories worn by or associated with elderly women.
definitions.example: granny dress; granny glasses

definitions.definition: Lively or enthusiastic.
definitions.example: She answered with a perky smile and bounced off.

definitions.definition: Standing upright; firm.
definitions.example: The plant looks much perkier since I watered it.

definitions.definition: A high-quality class of travelling (especially in airlines), higher than economy class or budget, lower than first class.
An area from which water drains into a particular lake, river, etc.; the catchment area of a large river includes its tributaries.
The area served by a local institution, such as a hospital or school, or by extension, a railway station.
The state in which the player to move is not in check but has no legal moves, resulting in a draw.
Any situation that has no obvious possible movement, but does not involve any personal loss.
To bring about a state in which the player to move is not in check but has no legal moves.
To bring about a stalemate, in which no advance in an argument is achieved.
An episodic comedy television program with a plot or storyline based around a particular humorous situation.
A person who is always very kind.
definitions.example: She is such a sweetheart: she never complains about me being late.

definitions.definition: A person very much liked or loved by someone, especially when both partners are young.
definitions.example: John married his high-school sweetheart in 1981.

definitions.definition: A female member of a college or university fraternity.
The belief that people of one sex or gender are inherently superior to others.
definitions.example: The notion that either gender is superior is sexism.

definitions.definition: Discrimination or different treatment (e.g. in job opportunities) based on sex or gender.
definitions.example: The fact that there is only one woman in a management position in that company makes it easy to believe that sexism runs rampant there.

definitions.definition: Attitudes or actions that are based on or promote the expectation that people adhere to stereotypical social roles (gender roles) based on sex.
definitions.example: the sexism of making and promoting violent films for men and romantic comedies for women

definitions.definition: A type of shoe with an inflexible, often wooden sole sometimes with an open heel.
definitions.example: Dutch people rarely wear clogs these days.

definitions.definition: A blockage.
definitions.example: The plumber cleared the clog from the drain.

definitions.definition: A shoe of any type.
A weight, such as a log or block of wood, attached to a person or animal to hinder motion.
That which hinders or impedes motion; an encumbrance, restraint, or impediment of any kind.
To block or slow passage through (often with 'up').
definitions.example: Hair is clogging the drainpipe.

definitions.definition: To encumber or load, especially with something that impedes motion; to hamper.
To burden; to trammel; to embarrass; to perplex.
To enforce a mortgage lender right that prevents a borrower from exercising a right to redeem.
To perform a clog dance.
A reptilian animal: a reptile.
A reptilian person, especially (racial slur) a Jew.
A reptilian alien, especially (often capitalized) of a shapeshifting race purported to secretly control the world.
Of or relating to the members of the class Reptilia.
Reptilelike.
Unthinking, low, base, contemptible.
Cold-blooded, treacherous, unavoidably selfish and hostile.
A protective layer over a body, vehicle, or other object intended to deflect or diffuse damaging forces.
A natural form of this kind of protection on an animal's body.
Metal plate, protecting a ship, military vehicle, or aircraft.
A tank, or other heavy mobile assault vehicle.
A military formation consisting primarily of tanks or other armoured fighting vehicles, collectively.
The naturally occurring surface of pebbles, rocks or boulders that line the bed of a waterway or beach and provide protection against erosion.
To equip something with armour or a protective coating or hardening.
To provide something with an analogous form of protection.
A line at the side of something.
Something that is additional or extra or that exists around the edges or margins of a main item.
definitions.example: She started the business as a sideline to her regular work and it ended up becoming the greater source of income.

definitions.definition: A line for hobbling an animal by connecting the fore and the hind feet of the same side.
A line defining the side boundary of a playing field.
Usually in the plural: the area outside the playing field beyond each sideline.
definitions.example: The coach stood on the sidelines and bellowed commands at the team.

definitions.definition: The outside or perimeter of any activity.
definitions.example: She installed the whole fixture while he simply watched from the sidelines.

definitions.definition: A secondary road, especially a byroad at right angles to a main road.
To place on the sidelines; to bench or to keep someone out of play.
definitions.example: The coach sidelined the player until he regained his strength.

definitions.definition: To remove or keep out of circulation or out of the focus.
definitions.example: The illness sidelined him for weeks.

definitions.definition: A dish made of small pieces of meat, with or without vegetables, which are skewered on a wooden or metal stick and roasted in an oven or over an open fire.
A crystal structure consisting of a central spine (the shish) and disks or lumps growing out from it (the kebab).
The result of shortening or reducing; abridgment.

A shortened or contracted form of a word or phrase, used to represent the whole, utilizing omission of letters, and sometimes substitution of letters, or duplication of initial letters to signify plurality, including signs such as +, =, @.
The process of abbreviating.
A notation used in music score to denote a direction, as pp or mf.
One or more dashes through the stem of a note, dividing it respectively into quavers, semiquavers, demisemiquavers, or hemidemisemiquavers.
Any convenient short form used as a substitution for an understood or inferred whole.
Loss during evolution of the final stages of the ancestral ontogenetic pattern.
Reduction to lower terms, as a fraction.
A person who has achieved sexual maturity but whose character and personality are still developing as they gain experience.
definitions.example: Young adult actress Annie Jay wrote a book called Stars in Your Eyes Feet on the Ground giving career advice for young adult actors.

definitions.definition: A piece of jewelry/jewellery, resembling a bracelet but worn around the ankle.
An ankle sock.
To signify beyond its literal or principal meaning.
definitions.example: Racism often connotes an underlying fear or ignorance.

definitions.definition: To possess an inseparable related condition; to imply as a logical consequence.
definitions.example: Poverty connotes hunger.

definitions.definition: To express without overt reference; to imply.
To require as a logical predicate to consequence.
Capable of either physical or coercive force; powerful.
The study of history, geography, civics, sociology, economics, and other social-science subjects, especially in primary and secondary school.
A unit of Japanese currency, worth one hundredth of a yen.
A coin of this value.
Self
definitions.example: "Hear all, see all, say nowt. Ate all, sup all, pay nowt. An if ever tha does anythin for nowt, mek sure tha does it for tha sen."

definitions.definition: A unit of length equal 20 wa, 40 meters
The patchy loss of skin pigmentation.
Alphos, a form of leprosy.
Bashful, showing modesty or embarrassment.
Ashamed, displaying shame, especially by blushing in the face.
A person who gives lectures, especially as a profession.
A member of a university or college below the rank of assistant professor or reader.
A member of the Church of England clergy whose main task was to deliver sermons (lectures) in the afternoons and evenings.
To set up a scaffolding; to surround a building with scaffolding.
To sustain; to provide support for.
To dispose of the bodies of the dead on a scaffold or raised platform, as by some Native American tribes.
A temporary modular system of tubes (or formerly wood) forming a framework used to support people and material in the construction or repair of buildings and other large structures.
Source code etc. that is incomplete and serves as a basis for further development.
Any framework or support.
Done or kept in secret, sometimes to conceal an illicit or improper purpose.
definitions.example: clandestine military operations

definitions.definition: (of a person or lodge) Not recognized as a regular member.
A vehicle (usually a bus, coach or train) or aircraft with two floors.
A frigate with two decks above the waterline.
(figuratively) Any object with two layers or parts stacked on top of each other.
definitions.example: A club sandwich is a double-decker of chicken, ham, lettuce and tomato.

definitions.definition: Two-handed backhand.
A play, film, or television programme with only two main characters.
A two-handed sword.
A food item requiring two hands to eat.
A young duck.
Of a person, taking their work seriously and doing it well and rapidly.
The primary attendant to the groom in a wedding ceremony.
The skill of making accurate shots
A bird, usually black, of the genus Corvus, having a strong conical beak, with projecting bristles; it has a harsh, croaking call.
The cry of the rooster.
Any of various dark-coloured nymphalid butterflies of the genus Euploea.
A bar of iron with a beak, crook, or claw; a bar of iron used as a lever; a crowbar.
A gangplank (corvus) used by the Ancient Roman navy to board enemy ships.
(among butchers) The mesentery of an animal.
A black person.
The emblem of an eagle, a sign of military rank.
To make the shrill sound characteristic of a rooster; to make a sound in this manner, either in gaiety, joy, pleasure, or defiance.
To shout in exultation or defiance; to brag.
definitions.example: He’s been crowing all day about winning the game of cards.

definitions.definition: To test the reed of a double reed instrument by placing the reed alone in the mouth and blowing it.

A non-commissioned officer in some infantry regiments of the British army, equivalent in rank to a staff sergeant in most other armies. A colour sergeant ranks above a sergeant and below a warrant officer.
The killing of one's mother.
definitions.example: Gerald was imprisoned for matricide: he strangled his mother.

definitions.definition: A person who kills his or her mother.
definitions.example: Nancy was a matricide; it happened four years ago.

definitions.definition: A warning or call to pay attention; an advisory notice; a notice of what is to happen; a holler.
definitions.example: Send everyone a heads-up about the inspection tomorrow.

definitions.definition: Involving two players. (usually said when there are only two players in the table; or, when all players except two folded)
definitions.example: There are seven players on the table. Five folded, the remaining two played heads-up until the showdown.

definitions.definition: With head directly above the neck, eyes front.
definitions.example: A heads-up posture meant the pilot couldn't pay attention to his instruments.

definitions.definition: Alert; vigilant
definitions.example: Getting those marbles off the red carpet was a real heads-up move.

definitions.definition: The main serving or dish of a meal, usually cooked.
An electronic component capable of storing electrical energy in an electric field; especially one consisting of two conductors separated by a dielectric.
A course of action which is dignified, honourable, or respectable.
A main road or highway.
